page.title: 11ABERGELE TOWN LIBRARY
page.content: The new library, opened in 1973, by the County Council, replaced one which had been housed in a local shop. There are two full time and 2 part time library assistants. The Librarian is Mr. B. Davies from Denbigh. Clwyd County Library Service has 10,000,000 books. 18,000 are held at Abergele coded on the Dewey decimal system, but others are obtainable from other branches and the Micro-fische Catalogue displays on-screen the County's book stock. Membership is open to everyone and books may be borrowed for two weeks normally. If books are overdue the borrower incurs a small cash fine. Wednesday is the quietest day and Friday is the busiest Opening times: 10 am-7 pm Monday to Friday; 10am-1pm Thursday; Saturday, Sunday closed. Children's activites are arranged during school holidays.
